item.title: Advisory white parking line between 46 & 48 Greenways, 7th October
item.description:
Between Nos. 46 & 48 Greenways there is no white advisory parking box marked - only a white line. People park there which makes it very difficult (and dangerous) to see when exiting from our house No.46. This also affects people in Nos. 39, 41 and 48 when exiting their properties, particularly when the marked white boxes outside Nos 39, 41 and 48 are occupied. As Greenways is currently being resurfaced, will the Council please give serious consideration to replacing the single white line between Nos. 46 & 48 with double yellow lines to prevent future parking there when the lines are redrawn after the resurfacing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greenways, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unroadworthy vehicleleft in Linton Grove, 7th October
item.description:
Linton Grove is currently being used as a mechanic’s repair site for the reconstruction of a vehicle that has been stationed there for several weeks and left propped up on a car jack. This situation poses a significant safety risk, particularly given the proximity of a school at the end of the road. A residential street is not an appropriate location for such activities.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Ladas Road, West Norwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flag on lamppost without permission, 7th October
item.description:
Under Section 132 of the Highways Act 1980, it’s an offence to affix anything to a structure on the highway (which would include lampposts) without the consent of the highway authority.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1,3, Old Farm Road East, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet
